title: Improve (automated) commit messages
body:
ATM automated commit messages ("Added content", "Recorded changes", ...) are useless.
Some (if not majority) of the commands, e.g. `*create` do not even allow to have commit message specified.  I wonder if we could improve upon that.

In many cases the intention/result of the command is clear. e.g. if I `create .../subds`, I think it would be better to commit "Added subdataset subds" and "Recorded changes caused by "Added subdataset subds'".  If there is multiple objects of action, they could be quantified (`X files, Y datasets`, etc).  And I think it should be possible if we collect a list of actions which were taken by the command before `*save` was invoked.

<details>
<summary>I do something like that in the (good, khe khe) and (definetely) old crawler:</summary>

```
    [DATALAD] Added files from extracted archives
    
    Files processed: 6202
     skipped: 4
     +annex: 6168
    Branches merged: incoming->incoming-processed

commit c6259378478bbcc634b3295b0c710886b9eecb01 (origin/incoming, synced/incoming, incoming)
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Tue May 16 23:20:05 2017 -0400

    [DATALAD] Updated git/annex from a remote location
    
    URLs processed: 34
    Files processed: 35
     skipped: 34
     +git: 1
```
</details>

Related: 
- https://github.com/datalad/datalad-revolution/pull/71 - for non-automated/user input messages
